title: China Eastern Plane Crash: Rescuers Find Suspected Engine, Hunt for Second Black Box
sub_head: Second black box’s positioning signal couldn’t be detected at the scene, state media says
body:
HONG KONG—Search and rescue teams on Thursday discovered what they suspect is an engine from the plane carrying 132 people that rammed into the mountains of southern China, as the hunt continued for the second black box.
With no signs of survivors three days after the crash, all aboard the Boeing 737 operated by China Eastern Airlines —nine aircrew and 123 passengers—are feared dead in what would be China’s worst air disaster in nearly three decades.
